headline.main: Foreign Diplomats Lose Optimism on Colombia Peace Talks

lead_paragraph: Foreign diplomats here had high expectations when President Andrés Pastrana's government and Colombia's largest rebel group embarked on a long-awaited peace effort three years ago. Invited as observers to negotiations, diplomats would trek to territory held by the group, the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, and effusively slap backs and shake hands with guerrilla commanders.
abstract: Foreign diplomats are doubtful about Colombian rebel group's commitment to peace and furious about its kidnappings of foreigners; European Union decides not to issue new travel visas to leaders of group, Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, and Britain orders its assets there frozen; other pressure tactics are being discussed; photo (M)
